etymology.description: 预(預) (yù, "in advance") + 订(訂) (dìng, "order") = to order in advance, hence to reserve or book
etymology.interpretation: The word 预订(預訂) (yùdìng, "reserve; book") combines the idea of taking action in advance with the act of ordering. This concept is applied when setting aside services or items before they are needed, such as booking a hotel room or reserving a table at a restaurant.
etymology.simplification: 预订 is the simplified form of 預訂.

examples.chinese: 我预订了酒店(我預訂了酒店)。
他预订了餐位(他預訂了餐位)，打算邀请朋友一起用餐(打算邀請朋友一起用餐)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yùdìngle cānwèi, dǎsuàn yāoqǐng péngyǒu yīqǐ yòngcān.
examples.english: He reserved a table, planning to invite friends to dine together.

examples.chinese: 我们预订了演唱会门票(我們預訂了演唱會門票)，期待美好的夜晚(期待美好的夜晚)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yùdìngle yǎnchànghuì ménpiao, qídài měihǎo de yèwǎn.
examples.english: We booked concert tickets, looking forward to a wonderful evening.
